title: Add Pinterest to social media link options in user profiles

requirements.text: Update the UserProfile data model in backend/main.mo to include a Pinterest link field in the socialMediaLinks record, storing the Pinterest profile URL as an optional Text value

quotes: Can you make it so I can link to Pinterest?

acceptanceCriteria: UserProfile type includes pinterest field in socialMediaLinks
Pinterest link is stored as optional Text
Existing profiles remain compatible with the schema change

requirements.text: Add Pinterest input field to the ProfileSetupModal component where users can enter their Pinterest profile URL alongside existing social media links (Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube)

quotes: Can you make it so I can link to Pinterest?

acceptanceCriteria: Pinterest input field is displayed in profile setup modal
Input field accepts Pinterest URL format
Pinterest link is included when submitting profile creation

requirements.text: Display the Pinterest link on the ProfilePage component as a clickable social media icon alongside other social links (Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube), opening the Pinterest profile in a new tab when clicked

quotes: Can you make it so I can link to Pinterest?

acceptanceCriteria: Pinterest icon is displayed when a user has a Pinterest link in their profile
Clicking the Pinterest icon opens the URL in a new browser tab
Pinterest icon matches the styling of other social media icons

requirements.text: Add Pinterest input field to profile editing functionality, allowing users to add or update their Pinterest profile URL after initial profile creation

quotes: Can you make it so I can link to Pinterest?

acceptanceCriteria: Users can edit their Pinterest link in profile settings
Changes to Pinterest link are saved to the backend
Updated Pinterest link is immediately reflected on the profile page

constraints: Do not modify the existing socialMediaLinks structure for other platforms
Maintain consistency with existing social media link patterns in the UI
